verbose_text: However, pretreatment with U0126, a selective MEK / ERK inhibitor, significantly reduced the production of TNFalpha and MCP-1 in both WT-and Spred2 KO-macrophages, suggesting that the cytokine response was dependent on the ERK / MAPK pathway.
evidence: U0126, a selective MEK/ERK inhibitor, significantly reduced the production of TNFalpha and MCP-1 in both WT-and Spred2 KO-macrophages                    , suggesting that the cytokine response was dependent on the ERK
